edu.unh.sdb.common
Class IntDatum

java.lang.Object
  edu.unh.sdb.common.Datum
      edu.unh.sdb.common.IntDatum

public class IntDatum
extends Datum

Represent multiple data values for a single point. This implementation stores values as an array of ints, regardless of the orginal type of an attribute.

IntDatum

public IntDatum(int[] values,
                int startIndex,
                int numAttributes)
Deprecated. Not really; just looking for usage because of changed semantics (01/05)

Creates a datum by copying a subset of values from an array. The second argument specifies where to start copying; the 3rd argument specifies how many values to copy.

public IntDatum(Datum d)
Copy Constructor creates a copy of the argument datum.

IntDatum

public IntDatum(IntDatum[] datums)
This constructor creates a single IntDatum from an array of datums. The Datums in the array are copied in the order they are given.

assign

public void assign(int[] values,
                   int startIndex,
                   int numAttributes)
Deprecated. Not really; just looking for usage because of changed semantics (01/05)

Assigns values to an existing datum by copying a subset of values from an array. The second argument specifies where to start copying; the 3rd argument defines how many values to copy. If this object contains too few attributes to hold the new data, an error is created.
